You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 11. Valāhakavagga
segments.en: 11. Clouds

segments.pli: 105. Ambasutta
segments.en: 105. Mangoes

segments.pli: “Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, ambāni.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four mangoes.

segments.pli: Katamāni cattāri?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Āmaṃ pakkavaṇṇi, pakkaṃ āmavaṇṇi, āmaṃ āmavaṇṇi, pakkaṃ pakkavaṇṇi—
segments.en:
1. One is unripe but seems ripe,
  2. one is ripe but seems unripe,
  3. one is unripe and seems unripe, and
  4. one is ripe and seems ripe.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri ambāni.
segments.en: These are the four mangoes.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro ambūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, these four people similar to mangoes are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Āmo pakkavaṇṇī, pakko āmavaṇṇī, āmo āmavaṇṇī, pakko pakkavaṇṇī.
segments.en:
1. One is unripe but seems ripe,
  2. one is ripe but seems unripe,
  3. one is unripe and seems unripe, and
  4. one is ripe and seems ripe.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti pakkavaṇṇī?
segments.en: And how is a person unripe but seems ripe?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti pakkavaṇṇī.
segments.en: That’s how a person is unripe but seems ripe.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ āmaṃ pakkavaṇṇi;
segments.en: That person is like a mango that’s unripe but seems ripe, I say.

segments.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti āmavaṇṇī?
segments.en: And how is a person ripe but seems unripe?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti āmavaṇṇī.
Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ pakkaṃ āmavaṇṇi;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti āmavaṇṇī?
segments.en: And how is a person unripe and seems unripe?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo āmo hoti āmavaṇṇī.
Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ āmaṃ āmavaṇṇi;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti pakkavaṇṇī?
segments.en: And how is a person ripe and seems ripe?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo pakko hoti pakkavaṇṇī.
Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, ambaṃ pakkaṃ pakkavaṇṇi;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro ambūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These four people similar to mangoes are found in the world.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
